text: Italian mid-engine design carbon-fiber
structure that pretty much sums up a
lamborghini aventador the 4c from Alfa
Romeo remember them it can save you 300
grand on all that well option this one's
a steal at 64 thousand bucks I'm Tom
Wolfe with driven for The New York Times
there's no real exterior model badge but
come on I wasn't gonna confuse this with
a Honda Civic Alfa Romeo left the US
market about 20 years ago their comeback
a pure driver's car maybe a little too
pure for some describing the driving
dynamic as direct is akin to calling
Everclear a beverage throttle response
electronic stability control and
transmission mapping can be adjusted but
even in its famous mode 4c makes a Miata
feel like an old Lexus for enthusiasts
who find modern electric power steering
too numb good news alphas
gets no assists at all feather light at
just under 2500 pounds
4c can streak to 60 in about four and a
half seconds signaling law enforcement
for miles sonically and visually it
sneaks up on no one this is not for the
Lincoln Towncar crowd the engine is
right here
you can really hear it not a bad thing
it is a loud thing though especially
with the racing exhaust which pretty
much eliminates the muffler fuel economy
is not half bad track grade breaks are
painfully effective the 1750 CC aluminum
engine bristles with tech including an
after unpopped bat once the engine is
shut down protects the turbo by
circulating the oil until it cools the
four-cylinder with 237 horsepower and
258 pound-feet of torque is mounted to
an aluminum cradle which is attached to
the carbon fiber tub so our front and
rear structural cells shifting is done
with a twin clutch 6-speed gearbox the
same one found in the Dodge Dart
tuned differently of course driven
slowly about town it does lack some
refinement 4c is best when pushed hard
our delivery can come on fast I find
myself maintaining turbo boost with
constant light throttle pressure to
smooth the dynamic the stiff suspension
will personally introduce you to every
crack pebble and rut in the road because
of that four C's natural habitat is the
track it's much more like lotus elise
than porsche came in fifty nine percent
of the weight rests on the rear tires
cornering is heroic
but 4c requires full attention while in
motion in return it delivers unique
unfiltered driving thrills with awful
visibility out the back granted I'm not
the most flexible guy in the world but
4c it's not particularly easy to get
into given the cacophony the stereo is
nearly worthless the wheel is perfect
the optional stitched leather dashboard
is lovely to behold carbon fiber
reinforced seats are snugged for big
guys but Headroom is generous for tall
or helmeted drivers alphas unique way of
insisting you will wear your seatbelts
I think I'm bleeding from the ears if
the Sun is at your side tough there is
little in the way of storage this is the
glovebox Alfa Romeo added airbags and
100 pounds of carbon fiber to meet u.s.
safety regulations thinking of taking
the 4c on a road trip go alone
with endurance and earplugs unlike
caiman there's no storage here it's
where your feet go foresees lightweight
composite skin is Italian sculpture to
rival Michelangelo's David
let's hope future US Alfa Romeo
offerings are half as stylish as this
weekend toy and much less high-strung
Oh
